title: rusda
text: interface web service methods provided United States Department Agriculture (USDA). Agricultural Research Service (ARS) provides large set databases. current version package holds interfaces Systematic Mycology Microbiology Laboratory (SMML), consists four databases: Fungus-Host Distributions, Specimens, Literature Nomenclature database. provides functions querying databases. main function , allows searching fungus-host combinations.

title: rusda
text: CRAN rOpenSci load rusda

title: rusda
text: following example, want search host fungus (Rosellinia ligniaria) fungal associations give host (Fagus sylvatica). expert knowledge, already know two species associated. Let us see, wheather USDA Fungus-Hosts Distributions database confirms knowledge. first specify input species vectors. case one element long (allowed longer, ). search associations look output. Since interested “real” species names choose ‘clean’ output. want full possible list associations choose ‘synonyms=TRUE’. Now want check initial knowledge correct: expert knowledge excellent.
code:
host <- "Fagus sylvatica" fungus <- "Rosellinia aquila" fungi <- associations(x = host, database = "both", clean = TRUE, syn_include = TRUE, spec_type = "plant", process = TRUE) hosts <- associations(x = fungus, database = "both", clean = TRUE, syn_include = TRUE, spec_type = "fungus", process = TRUE)  head(fungi$association$`Fagus sylvatica`) head(hosts$association$`Rosellinia aquila`) ## > head(fungi$association$`Fagus sylvatica`) ## [1] "Polyporus squamosus"       "Absidia glauca"            "Acia stenodon"             ## [4] "Acrogenospora megalospora" "Actinocladium rhodosporum" "Actinonema fagicola"  ## > head(hosts$association$`Rosellinia aquila`) ## [1] "Acer pseudoplatanus" "Acer rubrum"         "Acer sp."            "Alnus incana"        ## [5] "Alnus rubra"         "Asclepias sp." cat("Is R. aqulia a fungus growing on F. sylvatica? 
", is.element("Rosellinia aquila", pathogens$association[[1]])) cat("Is F. sylvatica a host for R. aqulia?
", is.element("Fagus sylvatica", hosts$association[[1]])) ## > cat("Is R. aqulia a fungus growing on F. sylvatica? 
", is.element("Rosellinia aquila", ## pathogens$association[[1]])) ## Is R. aqulia a fungus growing on F. sylvatica?  ##  TRUE ## > cat("Is F. sylvatica a host for R. aqulia?
", is.element("Fagus sylvatica", hosts$association[[1]])) ## Is F. sylvatica a host for R. aqulia? ##  TRUE

title: rusda
text: want know mean number associations group, e.g. Polyporales. Lets create species input vector Linnean species names derived GenBank. first step might want check many species deposited database. interested associations group, need query associations Polyporus species? can check firest running meta_smml pruning species without host data. , 27 38 species supported data … within genus Polyporus mean number host associations :
code: polyporus <- c("Polyporus_admirabilis", "Polyporus_alveoaris", "Polyporus_americanus", "Polyporus_arcularius", "Polyporus_brumalis", "Polyporus_chozeniae", "Polyporus_ciliatus", "Polyporus_corylinus", "Polyporus_craterellus", "Polyporus_dictyopus", "Polyporus_favescens", "Polyporus_fraxineus", "Polyporus_gayanus", "Polyporus_grammocephalus", "Polyporus_guianensis", "Polyporus_lepideus", "Polyporus_leprieurii", "Polyporus_leptocephalus", "Polyporus_longiporus", "Polyporus_melanopus", "Polyporus_meridionalis", "Polyporus_pinsitus", "Polyporus_pseudobetulinus", "Polyporus_radicatus", "Polyporus_rhizophilus", "Polyporus_squamosus", "Polyporus_squamulosus", "Polyporus_submelanopus", "Polyporus_subvarius", "Polyporus_tenuiculus", "Polyporus_tessellatus", "Polyporus_tricholoma", "Polyporus_tuberaster", "Polyporus_tubiformis", "Polyporus_udus", "Polyporus_umbellatus", "Polyporus_varius", "Polyporus_virgatus")  poly_meta <- meta_smml(x = polyporus, spec_type = "fungus", process = TRUE) head(poly_meta) ## > head(poly_meta) ##                      Nomenclature Specimens Host_Fungus Literature ## Polyporus_admirabilis            1         1           1          1 ## Polyporus_alveoaris              0         0           0          0 ## Polyporus_americanus             0         0           0          0 ## Polyporus_arcularius             1         1           1          1 ## Polyporus_brumalis               1         1           1          1 ## Polyporus_chozeniae              0         0           0          0 length(polyporus)                             # 38 all species nrow(poly_meta[rowSums(poly_meta)>0,])        # 27 with data species polyporus <- rownames(poly_meta[rowSums(poly_meta)>0,]) polyporus_ass <- associations(x = polyporus, database = "both", clean = TRUE, syn_include = TRUE, spec_type = "fungus", process = TRUE) cat("Mean of hosts: ", mean(unlist(lapply(polyporus_ass[[2]], length)))) ## > cat("Mean of hosts: ", mean(unlist(lapply(polyporus_ass[[2]], length)))) ## Mean of hosts:  22.88889

title: Authors and Citation
text: Franz-Sebastian Krah. Maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Franz-Sebastian Krah, Hanno Schaeffer, Christoph Heibl, Claus B{"{}}ssler, John Soghigian, David Hibbett (2018) Evolutionary dynamics host specialization wood-decay fungi BMC Evolutionary Biology, 18(1):119-132.
code: @Article{,   author = {Franz-Sebastian Krah and Hanno Schaefer and Christoph Heibl and Claus B{"{a}}ssler and John Soghigian and David Hibbett},   title = {Evolutionary dynamics of host specialization in wood-decay fungi},   year = {2018},   journal = {BMC Evolutionary Biology},   volume = {18},   issue = {1},   pages = {119-132}, }

title: Interface to USDA Databases
text: interface web service methods provided United States Department Agriculture (USDA). Agricultural Research Service (ARS) provides large set databases. current version package holds interfaces Systematic Mycology Microbiology Laboratory (SMML), consists four databases: Fungus-Host Distributions, Specimens, Literature Nomenclature database. provides functions querying databases. main function associations(), allows searching fungus-host combinations.

title: Interface to USDA Databases
text: CRAN (CRAN yet) rOpenSci load rusda

title: Interface to USDA Databases
text: following case want search host fungus (Rosellinia ligniaria) fungal associations give host (Fagus sylvatica). expert knowledge already know two species associated. Let’s see Fungus-Hosts Distributions database USDA confirms hypothesis. first specify input species vectors. case one element long (allowed longer, ). search associations look output. Since interested “real” species names choose ‘clean’ output. want full possible list associations choose ‘synonyms=TRUE’. Now want check initial knowledge correct: right. Now can happy search associations ;-).
code: host <- "Fagus sylvatica" fungus <- "Rosellinia aquila" fungi <- associations(host, database = "both", clean = TRUE, syn_include = TRUE, spec_type = "plant", process = TRUE) hosts <- associations(fungus, database = "both", clean = TRUE, syn_include = TRUE, spec_type = "fungus", process = TRUE)  head(fungi$association$`Fagus sylvatica`) #> [1] "Absidia glauca"            "Acia stenodon"             #> [3] "Acrogenospora megalospora" "Actinocladium rhodosporum" #> [5] "Actinonema fagicola"       "Alternaria alternata" head(hosts$association$`Rosellinia aquila`) #> [1] "Acer pseudoplatanus" "Acer rubrum"         "Acer sp."            #> [4] "Alnus incana"        "Alnus rubra"         "Asclepias sp." is.element("Rosellinia aquila", fungi$associations[[1]]) #> [1] TRUE is.element("Fagus sylvatica", hosts$association[[1]]) #> [1] TRUE

title: Interface to USDA Databases
text: want know mean number associations group, e.g. Polyporales. Lets create species input vector Linnean species names derived GenBank. first step might want check many species deposited database. need query associations Polyporus species? , 27 species supported data… within genus Polyporus mean number host associations :
code: polyporus <- c("Polyporus_admirabilis", "Polyporus_alveoaris", "Polyporus_americanus", "Polyporus_arcularius", "Polyporus_brumalis", "Polyporus_chozeniae", "Polyporus_ciliatus", "Polyporus_corylinus", "Polyporus_craterellus", "Polyporus_dictyopus", "Polyporus_favescens", "Polyporus_fraxineus", "Polyporus_gayanus", "Polyporus_grammocephalus", "Polyporus_guianensis", "Polyporus_lepideus", "Polyporus_leprieurii", "Polyporus_leptocephalus", "Polyporus_longiporus", "Polyporus_melanopus", "Polyporus_meridionalis", "Polyporus_pinsitus", "Polyporus_pseudobetulinus", "Polyporus_radicatus", "Polyporus_rhizophilus", "Polyporus_squamosus", "Polyporus_squamulosus", "Polyporus_submelanopus", "Polyporus_subvarius", "Polyporus_tenuiculus", "Polyporus_tessellatus", "Polyporus_tricholoma", "Polyporus_tuberaster", "Polyporus_tubiformis", "Polyporus_udus", "Polyporus_umbellatus", "Polyporus_varius", "Polyporus_virgatus")  poly_meta <- meta_smml(polyporus, process = TRUE, spec_type = "fungus") head(poly_meta) #>                       Nomenclature Specimens Host_Fungus Literature #> Polyporus_admirabilis            1         1           1          1 #> Polyporus_alveoaris              0         0           0          0 #> Polyporus_americanus             0         0           0          0 #> Polyporus_arcularius             1         1           1          1 #> Polyporus_brumalis               1         1           1          1 #> Polyporus_chozeniae              0         0           0          0 length(polyporus)                             # 38 all species nrow(poly_meta[rowSums(poly_meta)>0,])        # 27 with data species polyporus <- rownames(poly_meta[rowSums(poly_meta) > 0, ]) polyporus_ass <- associations(polyporus, database = "both", clean = TRUE, syn_include = TRUE, spec_type = "fungus", process = TRUE) mean(unlist(lapply(polyporus_ass[[2]], length))) #> [1] 23.25926

what: Downloads associations for input species from SMML Fungus-Host DB — associations
title: Downloads associations for input species from SMML Fungus-Host DB — associations
text: Searches downloads associations SMML Fungus-Hosts Distributions Specimens database fungus plant species input vector

title: Downloads associations for input species from SMML Fungus-Host DB — associations
code: associations(x, database = c("FH", "SP", "both"),   spec_type = c("plant", "fungus"), clean = TRUE, syn_include = TRUE,   process = TRUE, db = "ncbi")

title: Downloads associations for input species from SMML Fungus-Host DB — associations
text: x vector class character containing fungal plant species names genus name (see Details) database character string specifying databases queried. Valid "FH" (Fungus-Host Distributions), "SP" (Specimens) "" databases spec_type character string specifying type x.  Can either "plant" "fungus" clean logical, TRUE cleaning step run resulting associations list syn_include logical, TRUE associations synonyms searched added. complete synonyms list check rusda::synonyms process logical, TRUE downloading extraction process displayed db x higher species level, species higher taxon retrived using function taxize::downstream. one ITIS (itis), Catalogue Life (col), GBIF (gbif), NCBI (ncbi) selected. NCBI default.

title: Downloads associations for input species from SMML Fungus-Host DB — associations
text: object class list. First synonyms, second associations. Synonmys vector mode list synonyms x. Notice: complete list synonym data database. list synonyms contain data input x. complete synonyms list check rusda::synonyms (needed) fungi R package rmycobank. Associations vector mode list associations x

title: Downloads associations for input species from SMML Fungus-Host DB — associations
text: Fungus-Hosts distributions database 'FH' comprises data compiled Literature. uncleaned output kinds unspecified substrates documented like "submerged wood". Cleanded data displayes Linnean names species names either "subsp.","f. sp." "f.", "var.". Specimens database comprises entries field collections. genera names supplied, species derived NCBI taxonomy.

title: Downloads associations for input species from SMML Fungus-Host DB — associations
text: Franz-Sebastian Krah

title: Downloads associations for input species from SMML Fungus-Host DB — associations
code: if (FALSE) { ## Example for species name(s) as input x <- "Fagus sylvatica" pathogens <- associations(x, database = "both", clean = TRUE, syn_include = TRUE, spec_type = "plant", process = TRUE) x <- "Rosellinia ligniaria" hosts <- associations(x, database = "both", clean = TRUE, syn_include = TRUE,  spec_type = "fungus", process = TRUE) is.element("Rosellinia ligniaria", pathogens$association[[1]]) is.element("Fagus sylvatica", hosts$association[[1]])  ## Example for genus/genera name(s) as input x <- "Zehneria" # or x <- c("Zehneria", "Momordica") hosts <- associations(x, database = "both", clean = TRUE, syn_include = TRUE,  spec_type = "plant", process = TRUE) }

Agricultural Research Service (ARS) provides large set databases. current version package holds interfaces Systematic Mycology Microbiology Laboratory (SMML), consists four databases: Fungus-Host Distributions, Specimens, Literature Nomenclature database. provides functions querying databases. main function associations, allows searching fungus-host combinations.
